docstr:
`TTYNAM` — Get the name of a terminal device. ### Description Get the name of a terminal device. For more information, see `ttyname(3)`. This intrinsic is provided in both subroutine and function forms; however, only one form can be used in any given program unit. ### Syntax | `NAME = TTYNAM(UNIT)`
### Arguments . | `NAME` | Shall be of type `CHARACTER`. ### Example ``` PROGRAM test_ttynam   INTEGER :: unit   DO unit = 1, 10     IF (isatty(unit=unit)) write(*,*) ttynam(unit)   END DO END PROGRAM ``` ### Standard GNU extension ### Class Subroutine, function ### See also ISATTY
